website_summaries.verdict: Perhaps the most iconic among the Vans Slip-Ons, the Checkerboard Slip-On has proven its popularity, not just with the skaters or riders, but also among different types of folks, who all love Vans.While it doesn’t have much arch support, it has superb comfort, traction, and board feel. It also offers a trendy style suitable for any occasions. With a price that keeps the wallet smiling for a pair of classic sneakers, one can never go wrong with this
pros: The majority of the users of Vans Checkerboard Slip-On have praised its excellent comfort
Most users have expressed how the sneaker offers superb traction and board feel
A lot of buyers love the stylish design of the sneaker
Many consumers are highly-appreciative of the easy slip-on feature of the sneaker
Several reviewers love how the sneaker looks great with multiple outfit styles
A handful of reviewers have claimed that the Vans Checkerboard Slip-On is their go-to everyday pair
A good number of users have claimed to receive a lot of compliments when wearing the sneaker
Many purchasers have noted that they would recommend them
cons: A few users have pointed out that the shoe does not have arch support
One buyer mentions that the sneaker may need some break-in period

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Wear
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my hubby as he had problems with the Velcro fasteners which after a time becomes loose and does not hold. Also laces are difficult as he is disabled and struggles with slippers or trainers. Now he just pushes in his feet and he's ready to go. They look quite smart for simple casuals, soft enough comfortable wear for inside on the hard flooring or out. Good for people who drags their feet (after a stroke) as they will not slip off or come apart. At first they were a little difficult to put on as they were stiff being new but now, they're a part of his feet! Happy walking!
customer_reviews.author: Yochabel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love these Vans but there is a major with them and that is the elastic on the top that is suppose to stretch to allow your foot to go into the shoe is way too tight. The last vans I had like this one, I had to cut off the elastic from both sides to allow my foot to go in. This was about 3 years ago, this year I have bought another one and I can't believe that Vans did not fix this issue. Disappointed!

product_meta.title: Vans Men's Asher Slip On Trainers
product_meta.description: Inspired by Vans classic Slip-On, the Asher has a double-stitched toe cap, vulcanized construction and Vans signature rubber waffle outsole. A low-top style with a round toe, smooth lining and cushioning insole.
